accussed_details.name: Jameel Ahmed
allegation: Violation of Section 9(3)(c) of Control of Narcotic Substances Act, 1997

complaint_summary: On 18th October 2023, SI Sher Jan lodged FIR No. 281/2023 alleging that Jameel Ahmed was found in possession of 1178 grams of Charas during patrolling at Danuk Link Road.
investigation_summary: The investigation revealed contradictions in witness statements, improper documentation, and lack of evidence such as site maps and arrest cards. The prosecution failed to establish safe custody and transmission of seized contraband.
judgment_summary: The court found that the prosecution failed to prove the charges beyond reasonable doubt due to contradictory witness statements, procedural lapses, and lack of credible evidence. The conviction by the trial court was overturned, and Jameel Ahmed was acquitted.
Decision_or_verdict: Appeal allowed; conviction overturned; appellant acquitted.
legal_arguments: Contradictions in witness statements undermined credibility.
Failure to produce mandatory documents such as Randhari and site map.
Improper handling of seized contraband and lack of safe custody evidence.
Benefit of doubt principle applied due to lack of consistent evidence.

contradictions: PW-1 failed to obtain signatures of IO in Register No. 19.
PW-2 contradicted timing of parcel preparation and recovery memo.
PW-3 failed to produce Randhari or FSL receipt.
PW-4 contradicted earlier statements regarding place and time of occurrence.
PW-5 admitted procedural lapses including absence of site map.

key_issues: Application of benefit of doubt principle

maxims.benefit_of_doubt: Accused entitled to benefit of doubt as a matter of right.

legal_terms.Randhari: Document detailing safe custody of evidence.

summary_vector_notes: The appellant was acquitted due to lack of credible evidence, procedural lapses, and contradictions in witness statements. The trial court's judgment was overturned, emphasizing the principle of benefit of doubt.

trial_court.name: Special Judge, CNS/Additional Sessions Judge, Turbat

appeal_details.grounds: Contradictions and dishonest improvements in prosecution evidence, lack of safe custody of case property, absence of site plan, and procedural violations under Section 21 of CNSA, 1997.

key_findings.safe_custody: Failure to produce Randhari or laboratory receipt.
key_findings.procedural_errors: No site plan or card of arrest prepared.

legal_principles.benefit_of_doubt: Accused entitled to benefit of doubt as a matter of right.
legal_principles.mandatory_vs_directory: Distinction between imperative and directory provisions in law.
